[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Clarus system defines requirements for a road weather data management system to enable efficient data collection, quality control, and dissemination.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: Clarus facilitates real-time weather data ingestion, anomaly detection, and reporting for road safety.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: Clarus integrates with weather data sources and transportation agencies for structured data exchange.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: Clarus provides dashboards with real-time analytics and role-based access for DOT personnel.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: Clarus supports integration with weather sensors and roadside infrastructure.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: Clarus offers APIs for third-party data access and platform integration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: Clarus ensures secure data transmission via HTTP/HTTPS.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: Clarus optimizes memory usage for large dataset storage and processing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: Clarus supports real-time data processing and event monitoring.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: Clarus is configurable for various regional weather monitoring needs.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: Clarus enables real-time weather data ingestion, quality assessment, and anomaly detection.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Clarus is designed for DOT analysts, responders, and transportation agencies requiring weather insights.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Clarus depends on sensor compatibility and stable data-sharing agreements.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Clarus assumes operational weather stations and secure data transmission.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Clarus: A road weather observation and decision-support system.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall ingest weather data from DOT sensors via secure APIs.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide real-time weather updates through an interactive dashboard.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall perform continuous quality control on incoming data (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall generate alerts for detected data anomalies (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall support spatial queries for localized weather data retrieval.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive dashboard for non-technical users.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall allow users to customize data views and reports.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-003: The system shall support accessibility features such as screen readers.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process incoming weather data within 5 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store quality-controlled data for 7 days (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall implement indexing mechanisms for efficient queries.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-003: The system shall store metadata for traceability and audits.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall follow open-source weather data standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with data security and privacy regulations.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Functional, performance, and integration testing shall validate API data exchange, anomaly detection, and quality control.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, and weather dataset specifications.
[SEC] 5. References: Clarus Concept of Operations, DOT Weather Standards, and Security Guidelines.
